description: Chest X-ray interpretation for pneumonia with systematic review approach
system_instruction: Present a case requiring comprehensive analysis of chest imaging findings. Focus on systematic review and differential diagnosis.

patient_persona.name: Sarah Wilson
patient_persona.chief_complaint: Fever and productive cough for 5 days
patient_persona.background_story: Previously healthy, developed symptoms after family gathering

initial_prompt: The patient presents with fever and cough. Please review the chest X-ray findings.

imaging_findings.description: Left lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms and silhouette sign
key_findings: Alveolar infiltrate in left lower lobe

dose_parameters.comparison: Equivalent to 10 days natural background radiation

radiation_safety.clinical_justification: Suspected pulmonary infection requiring imaging confirmation

reporting_components.clinical_history: 45-year-old female with fever and productive cough for 5 days
reporting_components.findings_description: Left lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms
recommendations: Follow-up chest X-ray in 4-6 weeks to ensure resolution

end_session.patient_response: Thank you for the detailed interpretation. I'll discuss treatment options with the physician.

critical_finding.response: This finding requires immediate communication to the treating physician.

evaluation_criteria.Systematic_Approach: Comprehensive review of all anatomical structures using standardized approach
evaluation_criteria.Finding_Identification: Accurate detection and characterization of pathological findings
evaluation_criteria.Differential_Diagnosis: Appropriate differential considerations with supporting evidence
evaluation_criteria.Report_Quality: Clear, structured reporting with appropriate recommendations
evaluation_criteria.Radiation_Safety: Awareness of radiation dose and optimization principles
evaluation_criteria.Clinical_Correlation: Integration of clinical information with imaging findings
evaluation_criteria.Communication: Clear communication of findings and clinical significance

description: CT head interpretation for acute stroke assessment
system_instruction: Simulate a case requiring urgent CT head interpretation for suspected stroke. Focus on early ischemic changes and hemorrhage detection.

patient_persona.name: Robert Johnson
patient_persona.chief_complaint: Sudden right-sided weakness and speech difficulty
patient_persona.background_story: Woke up with symptoms 2 hours ago, history of hypertension and atrial fibrillation

initial_prompt: Emergency CT head performed for acute neurological symptoms. Please interpret urgently.

clinical_dossier.hidden_diagnosis: Acute Left MCA Territory Ischemic Stroke

imaging_findings.description: Early ischemic changes in left MCA territory with loss of gray-white differentiation
key_findings: Loss of insular ribbon on left side
Early hypodensity in left basal ganglia

parenchyma.supratentorial: Early ischemic changes left MCA territory

radiation_safety.clinical_justification: Time-sensitive evaluation for potential thrombolysis candidate

reporting_components.clinical_history: 68-year-old male with acute right hemiparesis and aphasia
reporting_components.findings_description: Early ischemic changes in left MCA territory with hyperdense vessel sign
reporting_components.impression: Findings consistent with acute left MCA territory ischemic stroke
recommendations: Consider CT angiography for vessel assessment

critical_findings.finding: Acute ischemic stroke with potential for intervention
critical_findings.communication_requirements: Immediate verbal communication to emergency physician
critical_findings.documentation: Time of discovery and communication documented

end_session.patient_response: The stroke team has been notified and is reviewing for treatment options.

critical_finding.response: This is an emergency finding requiring immediate intervention.

evaluation_criteria.Ischemic_Changes: Detection of early stroke signs and ASPECTS scoring
